Title.evidence: The rationale and design of the Surgical Treatment for Ischemic Heart Failure (STICH) trial is described.

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomization of consenting patients with heart failure, left ventricular (LV) ejection fraction ≤0.35, and coronary artery disease is based on whether patients are judged by attending physicians to be candidates only for CABG or for MED or CABG.

Participants.evidence: Randomization of consenting patients with heart failure, left ventricular (LV) ejection fraction ≤0.35, and coronary artery disease.

Intervention.evidence: Patients eligible for MED are randomly assigned between MED only and MED with CABG.

Objective.evidence: STICH is an NHLBI-funded multicenter international randomized trial addressing 2 specific primary hypotheses.

Method_Outcome.evidence: STICH is an NHLBI-funded multicenter international randomized trial addressing 2 specific primary hypotheses.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization of consenting patients with heart failure, left ventricular (LV) ejection fraction ≤0.35, and coronary artery disease is based on whether patients are judged by attending physicians to be candidates only for CABG or for MED or CABG.

Funding.evidence: STICH is an NHLBI-funded multicenter international randomized trial.
